quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Following and Constitution
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, garry. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT true concerning the term (length) of office according to the US Constitution?

options.text: two years for a member of the House of Representatives
two years for a member of the cabinet
six years for a member of the Senate

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: two years for a member of the cabinet

questions.question: Which statement concerning the US President is NOT true?

options.text: The US President is commander-in-chief of all US armed forces.
The US President can remove a member of the House of Representatives from office.
The US President is required to give a state of the union report to Congress (usually once a year).
The US President can give pardons for federal crimes.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The US President can remove a member of the House of Representatives from office.

questions.question: The constitution of the US presently used is the second constitution of the United States that was approved by the states. What was the first one called?

options.text: Constitution of the Former Colonies of Britain in North America
Constitution of the Independent States of North America

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Articles of Confederation

questions.question: What Oscar-winning actress plays the female lead in Ivan Reitmans romantic comedy film No Strings Attached?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Natalie Portman

questions.question: When and where was the second Constitution of the United States written?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in 1787 in Philadelphia

questions.question: What Academy Award-winning actor plays the king of Asgard and father of Thor in Kenneth Branaghs superhero movie Thor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anthony Hopkins

questions.question: What 2011 movie is not correctly matched with the actors starring in it?

options.text: Friends with Benefits - Mila Kunis, Justin Timberlake, Patricia Clarkson
The Ides of March - Paul Giamatti, George Clooney, Philip Seymour Hoffman
Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy - Gary Oldman, Colin Firth, Tom Hardy
Contagion - Steve Carell, Ryan Gosling, Julianne Moore

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Contagion - Steve Carell, Ryan Gosling, Julianne Moore

questions.question: What is the number of members of the Senate for each US state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: two

questions.question: In the 2011 movie Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows, these two actors star as Sherlock Holmes and his sidekick Dr. Watson who join forces to outwit their fiercest adversary, Professor Moriarty.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Downey, Jr. -  Jude Law

questions.question: Name the famous director of the 2011 movies War Horse and The Adventures of Tintin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steven Spielberg

questions.question: How does a bill (proposed law) become a law in the US?

options.text: It must be passed by the Senate.
It must be passed by the House of Representatives.
It must be signed by the President (unless 2/3 of the House and Senate vote in favor of the law).

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The US Constitution provides for three branches of the US government. Which of the following is NOT one of those branches?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: State Branch

questions.question: This romantic comedy film, directed by Garry Marshall, follows the lives of several couples and singles from New York City and shows how their lives intertwine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Years Eve

questions.question: Who directed The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo, a drama/thriller movie centered around the search for a woman who has been missing for forty years?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Fincher

questions.question: Which statement is true about the justices (judges) of the US Supreme Court?

options.text: They are appointed by the US President with the Senates approval.
All (including the Chief Justice) have one vote in deciding a case.
They serve for life unless they resign.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: all of these

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Katniss and Novel
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, profession, quote. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: To protect the rights of US citizens ten amendments (changes) were added to the constitution that guarantee the freedom of speech, freedom of the press, etc. What is the common name for these ten amendments?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the bill of rights

questions.question: In The Hunger Games, Katniss and Peeta are faced by the muttations of other dead tributes. Who is the only other survivor who suffers painfully from the attack of the wolf-like creatures and is eventually killed by Katniss out of pity and compassion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cato

questions.question: The US Constitution specifically gives Congress the power to pass laws that do all of the following EXCEPT this one.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: appoint members of the cabinet

questions.question: This Gothic heroine left the love of her life when she discovered he was already married but they reunited in the end.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jane Eyre

questions.question: In the novel The Hunger Games, Katniss finds out that both tributes from the same district can win and when she sees Peeta again, he is injured badly in which body part?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: his leg

questions.question: The 18th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution was abolished by a later amendment (the 21st amendment ). What did the 18th amendment do?

options.text: required jury trials in all federal courts
banned the ownership of hand guns in the US
banned the production and sale of alcoholic beverages
prohibited the immigration of Chinese and Japanese

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: banned the production and sale of alcoholic beverages

questions.question: What is the name of Katniss Everdeens 12 year-old sister in the novel The Hunger Games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Primrose

questions.question: Which of the following can declare unconstitutional and therefore void a law by a state or the federal government that violates the US Constitution?

options.text: the entire Congress (House of Representatives and Senate)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Supreme Court

questions.question: In The Hunger Games, when Katniss finds Rue trapped in a net, she barely has time to scream before a boy from District 3 kills her.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Katniss, the protagonist of the novel The Hunger Games, was named after which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: flower

questions.question: In the novel The Hunger Games, when faced with the cornucopia, Katniss planned to grab what weapon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: bow and arrows

questions.question: Complete this quote from a novel by Jane Austen: No one who had ever met _____ ______ in her infancy would have supposed her born to be a heroine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Catherine Morland

questions.question: Fictional character Katniss Everdeen used tracker jackers to help her escape. Tracker jackers are a type of genetically modified wasps.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This Gothic heroine lifted the famous black veil and spent time at a castle in Italy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emily St. Aubert

questions.question: What profession does Peeta Mellarks father have in the book The Hunger Games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: baker

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Country and Character
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, wilkie. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the name of the first solar-powered spacecraft on a mission to Jupiter that was launched from Cape Canaveral Air Force Station in August 2011?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Juno

questions.question: This Gothic heroine was so popular that Wilkie Collins received letters from male fans asking him for the name of the woman the character was based on, so they could propose to her.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marian Halcombe

questions.question: Which of these is considered the first Gothic heroine ever?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: none of these

questions.question: An estimated two billion people watched the royal wedding of Prince William and Catherine Middleton, which took place on 29 April, 2011 at this venue in London.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Westminster Abbey

questions.question: This character from the novel House of Stairs is one of the few homosexual Gothic heroines in the history of Gothic literature.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth Vetch

questions.question: In February 2011, the president of this country resigned after widespread protests calling for his departure and transferred authority to the Armed Forces.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Egypt

questions.question: On January 24, 2011 an international airport in this European capital became the focus of a suicide bomber attack.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moscow

questions.question: In First Love: A Gothic Tale, the Gothic heroine is a corrupted child who commits a murder.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In July 2011, this media magnate faced allegations that his companies had been regularly hacking the phones of celebrities, royalty and public citizens.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rupert Murdoch

questions.question: Dominican author Jean Rhys first encountered this heroine when she read Jane Eyre. She was so furious at Charotte Brontes portrayal of the character (which could be considered racist) that she decided to write a prequel to Jane Eyre in which this character is the Gothic heroine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antoinette Mason

questions.question: Sethe, an untraditional Gothic heroine in Toni Morrisons Beloved, ends up with her first love at the end of the novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In May, 2011, American President Barack Obama announced that Osama bin Laden had been killed during an American military operation in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pakistan

questions.question: On March 11, 2011, a 9.1-magnitude earthquake and subsequent tsunami hit this country, killing 15,822 and leaving another 3,926 missing.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Japan

questions.question: An uprising which started in February 2011 led to a civil war in this Arab country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Libya

questions.question: The Adbusturs activist group, which initiated the Occupy Wall Street (OWS) series of demonstrations, is based in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Canada

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Us and Novels
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, john, poe. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: His most famous works are the novels War and Peace, Anna Karenina and Resurrection.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lev Tolstoy

questions.question: Crime and punishment and Brothers Karamazov are novels written by Fyodor Mikhailovich Dostoevsky.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: A reason for declaring war on Mexico, given by US pro-war politicians, was that Mexican troops had attacked US troops on US soil. This American congressman, who later became US President, challenged the assertion that the spot where the attack took place was on US territory.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abraham Lincoln

questions.question: For most of his career he worked for a playing company known as Men of Lord Chamberlain.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shakespeare

questions.question: What popular author made this statement about religion: Man is a Religious Animal. He is the only Religious Animal. He is the only animal that has the True Religion—several of them. He is the only animal that loves his neighbor as himself and cuts his throat if his theology isn’t straight.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark Twain

questions.question: Which of the following works was not written by John Steinbeck?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Abbot

questions.question: Known as Old Rough and Ready, he was elected president of the US partly because he gained fame by victories over the Mexicans in northern Mexico during the Mexican–American War.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zachary Taylor

questions.question: Edgar Allan Poe is widely considered the inventor of the detective fiction genre.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What European countrys government buildings were bombed in July 2011 by a terrorist, named Anders Breivik?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Norway

questions.question: Which of these authors lived her entire life as part of a close-knit family and was educated mainly by her father and older brothers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jane Austen

questions.question: In what year did the war between the US and Mexico begin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1846

questions.question: Sir Arthur Clarke is a British writer an inventor known for his science fiction novel Space Odyssey.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these novels was not penned by Charles Dickens?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tess of the dUrbervilles

questions.question: Who was the President of the US during the Mexican-American War?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Polk

questions.question: Which statement is true about Sir Walter Scott, the author of Ivanhoe and Rob Roy

options.text: He studied medicine and became a doctor.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was a Scottish writer

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: War and Animals
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, birds, guadalupe. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these was a result of the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo that ended the Mexican-American War?

options.text: Mexico gave up all claims to Texas.
The US paid Mexico 15 million dollars.
Mexico ceded California to the US.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: These are among the most intelligent animals in the world but they can spread very dangerous diseases.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rats

questions.question: In Irish mythology, crows are associated with Morrigan, the goddess of war and death.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Pigeons can find their way home over extremely long distances.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The capture of this city in the Mexican–American War was the final American victory that caused the Mexicans to surrender.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mexico City

questions.question: Dogs are often used to find truffles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: These animals use their tail to communicate with other representatives of their species.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Squirrel

questions.question: Which of the following doctrines (common concepts) among US citizens most strongly influenced the US to go to war with Mexico?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: manifest destiny

questions.question: The rock band Rush was singing about this famous Tom in 1981.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sawyer

questions.question: These birds have a thick tongue which allows them to imitate human speech?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Parrots

questions.question: Which of the following military men fought in the Mexican-American war and later played a significant role as an officer in the US Civil War?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What statement is true about dolphins?

options.text: They have a “dictionary” of 14 000 audio sounds.
The brain of an adult dolphin weighs about 1700 grams.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Although there were disputes over this territory, there were no significant battles in it during the US-Mexican War.

options.text: There were significant battles in all three of these territories.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Texas

questions.question: Which of thse animals have a musical ear and musical memory and are able to distinguish three melody sounds?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elephants

questions.question: NASA sent a chimp into space in the 1960s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Meat and Silvio Berlusconi
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, improvements, chicken. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Silvio Berlusconi founded a centre-right party in 2009.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Silvio Berlusconi was born in Milan in 1946.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Some types of red meat, such as pork contain large amounts of saturated fats, which increase levels of bad cholesterol in the blood.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which herding dog breed is widely recognized as the smartest breed of dog in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Border collie

questions.question: Which of the following elements is present in meat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The iron in meat and fish is absorbed and utilized in the human body more efficiently than iron in other foods.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Buddhism prohibits killing animals for food.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Hasenpfeffer is a traditional German food typically made from which type of meat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: hare

questions.question: Beef is considered a taboo food in some cultures.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The omega 3 fatty acids found fish can make improvements in brain development.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Mioglobin, a protein which supplies the muscles with oxygen, is found in beef, pork, lamb and sea foods.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Sivio Berlusconi officially resigned as Prime Minister of Italy in 2011.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Red meat contains large quantities of iron.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Chicken fat is one of two types of animal fat referred to as Schmaltz.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What nickname is Silvio Berlusconi known by?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Il Cavaliere (The Knight)
